Answer: Well, by “written” can I assume you are referring to typing as well as handwritten? Most people who text are still, technically, typing maybe with only 1 finger but using a visible keyboard, so, they are still spelling out a word and therefore “writing”. If all communication switched to speaking only then it would indeed regress communication thousands of years. Plus, the computer would still have to spell out the message unless instead, it “spoke” it to the receiver. My guess is, slowly we would become incomprehensible to each other. Children would have no organized way to learn to speak corrWell, by “written” can I assume you are referring to typing as well as handwritten? Most people who text are still, technically, typing maybe with only 1 finger but using a visible keyboard, so, they are still spelling out a word and therefore “writing”. If all communication switched to speaking only then it would indeed regress communication thousands of years. Plus, the computer would still have to spell out the message unless instead, it “spoke” it to the receiver. My guess is, slowly we would become incomprehensible to each other. Children would have no organized way to learn to speak correctly. It would become a real disaster.
